intro: Ctenitis pubigera, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a rare and fascinating plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ctenophoraceae and is characterized by its unique, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salt-laden environments, showcasing its resilience. Its morphology includes a low-growing habit with fleshy, lobed leaves that help it retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
